Name: Publication of the dept of correction's policies on the use of force.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the publication of the department of correction's policies on the use of force.
BodyName: Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee

History.Description: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Mayor
This Introduction was Signed Into Law by Mayor
This Introduction was Recved from Mayor by Council

Summary: This bill requires the Department of Correction to publish their rules and regulations/directives regarding the use of force by Correction staff on inmates, including describing in what circumstances the use of force, or the use of certain equipment, is warranted.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      Section 1.  Chapter 1 of title 9 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 9-138 to read as follows:   
 
      	� 9-138 Use of force directive. The commissioner shall post on the department's website the directive stating the department's current policies regarding the use of force by departmental staff on inmates, including but not limited to the circumstances in which any use of force is justified, the circumstances in which various levels of force or various uses of equipment are justified, and the procedures staff must follow prior to using force. The commissioner may redact such directive as necessary to preserve safety and security in the facilities under the department's control.
      � 2. This local law takes effect 30 days after it becomes law.
BC
LS 4559
8/5/15, 9:04 P.M.
